alert.note: Alert for Cibola (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 26 at 4:00PM MDT until August 26 at 5:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHEASTERN CIBOLA COUNTY... At 400 PM MDT, While rainfall has currently come to an end over the warned area, earlier thunderstorms produced between 1.5 and 2.75 inches of rain, and this will continue to lead to excessive runoff and flash flooding through the late afternoon. HAZARD...Heavy rainfall from earlier thunderstorms producing excessive runoff. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Excessive runoff and flash flooding of small creeks, washes and streams, roads as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. This includes Seboyeta Creek and the Rio Paguate. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cebolletita, Mesita, Seboyeta, Bibo and Paguate. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 near Mile Marker 116. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Arroyos, streams, and normally dry rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes. Water in arroyos can travel many miles and take hours to reach your location from upstream rain areas.
